intro: Hesperis kurdica var. kurdica, commonly known as Kurdish sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its distinctive cruciform flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bright yellow or white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and wildflower meadows. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty and pollinator attraction.
